metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7674 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the pixops_scale_nearest function in pixops/pixops.c in gdk-pixbuf before 2.32.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted GIF image file, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7674` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gdkpixbuf-2.0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2
libgdk-pixbuf2.0-common - 2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gdk-pixbuf package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30.7-0ubuntu1.2').
